an6.69:4.1: Then, late at night, a beautiful god, lighting up the entire Jeta’s Grove, went up to the Buddha,
an6.69:4.4: “Sir, these six things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant.
an6.69:4.6: Respect for the Teacher, for the teaching, for the Saṅgha, for the training; being easy to correct, and good friendship.
an6.69:4.7: These six things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant.”
an6.69:4.10: Then that god, knowing that the teacher approved, bowed and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before vanishing right there.
an6.69:5.1: Then, when the night had passed, the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
an6.69:5.2: “Tonight, a beautiful god, lighting up the entire Jeta’s Grove, came to me,
an6.69:5.5: “Sir, these six things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant.
an6.69:5.7: Respect for the Teacher, for the teaching, for the Saṅgha, for the training; being easy to correct, and good friendship.
an6.69:5.8: These six things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant.”
an6.69:5.9: That is what that god said.
an6.69:5.10: Then he bowed and respectfully circled me, keeping me on his right side, before vanishing right there.”
an6.69:6.1: When he said this, Venerable Sāriputta said to the Buddha:
an6.69:6.2: “Sir, this is how I understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement.
an6.69:6.3: It’s when a mendicant personally respects the Teacher and praises such respect.
an6.69:6.4: And they encourage other mendicants who lack such respect to respect the Teacher.
an6.69:6.5: And they praise other mendicants who respect the Teacher at the right time, truthfully and substantively.
an6.69:6.9: They are personally easy to correct …
an6.69:6.10: They personally have good friends, and praise such friendship.
an6.69:6.11: And they encourage other mendicants who lack good friends to develop good friendship.
an6.69:6.12: And they praise other mendicants who have good friends at the right time, truthfully and substantively.
an6.69:6.13: That’s how I understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement.”
an6.69:7.2: It’s good that you understand the detailed meaning of what I’ve said in brief like this.
an6.69:7.3: It’s when a mendicant personally respects the Teacher …
an6.69:7.9: They are personally easy to correct …
an6.69:7.10: They personally have good friends, and praise such friendship.
an6.69:7.11: And they encourage other mendicants who lack good friends to develop good friendship.
an6.69:7.12: And they praise other mendicants who have good friends at the right time, truthfully and substantively.
an6.69:7.13: This is how to understand the detailed meaning of what I said in brief.”
